headline.main: NEW DC-9 SET FOR BELATEWD DEBUT

results.snippet: The McDonnell Douglas DC-9 Super 80 will belatedly roll off assembly lines in Long Beach, Calif., this month, its appearance delayed by production problems, inexperienced workers and a tardy safety certification by the Federal Aviation...

byline.original: Special to the New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: The McDonnell Douglas DC-9 Super 80 will belatedly roll off assembly lines in Long Beach, Calif., this month, its appearance delayed by production problems, inexperienced workers and a tardy safety certification by the Federal Aviation Administration. The plane has been well received by world airlines, which have placed 87 firm orders to date, and is being enthusiastically marketed by the McDonnell Douglas sales force.

results.abstract: first McDonnell Douglas DC-9 Super 80 jetliners will begin rolling off assembly lines during September, months behind schedule, because of production and labor problems and delayed Federal Aviation Administration safety certification; plane has been well received by world airlines, which have placed 87 firm orders to date; company president, John C Brizendine, comments; craft is not expected to return profit until '83; photo of craft on maiden flight, Oct '79 (M)

results.snippet: It's terrific to be home, that I can tell you,'' Vernon E.  Jordan said yesterday. The National Urban League president, who was shot more than three months ago in a parking lot in Indiana, had just been released from New York Hospital-Cornell Medical...

byline.original: By Judith Cummins and Albin Krebs

results.lead_paragraph: It's terrific to be home, that I can tell you,'' Vernon E. Jordan said yesterday. The National Urban League president, who was shot more than three months ago in a parking lot in Indiana, had just been released from New York Hospital-Cornell Medical Center. ''I'm not going to do much talking about what happened to me until next week,'' said Mr. Jordan, who was reached by telephone at his Fifth Avenue apartment. ''I plan to just sit around here for a few days and be in the office Monday.''

results.abstract: Jordan is released from NY Hospital-Cornell Medical Center; special security precautions have been taken at Jordan home; no arrests have been made in case; portrait (S)

results.abstract: Comment on newly revised 15th edition of Bartlett's Familiar Quotations, which Little Brown & Co is publishing on Sept 29; illustration; some famous quotes given (M)

headline.main: 'Play It Again, Sam': (Revised Ed.); 'Play It Again, Sam' (Revised Edition) Stevenson Cuts and Additions

results.snippet: The newly revised 15th edition of "Bartlett's Familiar Quotations"--the book that for 125 years has made students and scholars and speechmakers seem smarter than they are as they looked up erudite quotations and sprinkled them among their own...
results.lead_paragraph: The newly revised 15th edition of "Bartlett's Familiar Quotations"--the book that for 125 years has made students and scholars and speechmakers seem smarter than they are as they looked up erudite quotations and sprinkled them among their own words--proves once again that "all is ephemeral--fame and the famous as well" (Marcus Aurelius Antoninus).

headline.main: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., Sept. 13 (AP) - A chartered DC-3 carrying 34  persons from Florida to a Bahamas casino resort crashed into the Atlantic Ocean  in a fierce storm last night and Federal investigators said they were looking into the possibility of sabotage.

results.snippet: Officials searching for bodies in rough seas today said they feared that there were no survivors.  The Florida Commuter Airlines plane, which carried 30  passengers and a crew of four, went down a few miles short of its destination in Freeport, the...
results.lead_paragraph: Officials searching for bodies in rough seas today said they feared that there were no survivors. The Florida Commuter Airlines plane, which carried 30 passengers and a crew of four, went down a few miles short of its destination in Freeport, the Bahamas, amid high winds, funnel clouds, rain, thunder and lightning. The Federal Aviation Administration said the plane had briefly aborted its first attempt to take off from the Palm Beach International Airport because of apparent minor engine trouble.

results.abstract: Florida Commuter Airlines: Chartered DC-3 with 34 aboard crashes into Atlantic off Freeport, Bahamas; no survivors repotted; 16 bodies recovered; photo; map (M)

headline.main: Soviet Lofts a Capsule With Cuban Astronaut

results.snippet: MOSCOW, Sept. 18 (AP)--A Cuban astronaut and a Soviet mission commander rocketed into space tonight aboard the Soyuz 38 spaceship, the Soviet press agency, Tass, reported.
results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Sept. 18 (AP)--A Cuban astronaut and a Soviet mission commander rocketed into space tonight aboard the Soyuz 38 spaceship, the Soviet press agency, Tass, reported.

headline.main: Soviet Lofts a Capsule With Cuban Astronaut

results.snippet: A Cuban astronaut and a Soviet mission commander rocketed into space tonight  aboard the Soyuz 38 spaceship, the Soviet press agency, Tass, reported.         The Cuban astronaut, Arnaldo Tamayo Mendez, is the seventh non-Soviet to fly  in the Soviet...
results.lead_paragraph: A Cuban astronaut and a Soviet mission commander rocketed into space tonight aboard the Soyuz 38 spaceship, the Soviet press agency, Tass, reported. The Cuban astronaut, Arnaldo Tamayo Mendez, is the seventh non-Soviet to fly in the Soviet Union's Intercosmos space program. He and his Soviet mission commander, Yuri V. Romanenko, are to link up with the Soviet Salyut 6 space station, where two Soviet astronauts are within two weeks of breaking a space endurance record.

results.abstract: Cuban air force pilot Arnaldo Tamayo Mendez is lofted into earth orbit with cosmonaut Yuri V Romanenko aboard Soyuz spacecraft, which docks with orbiting Salyut 6 space station (S)

headline.main: 2 in Soviet Spacecraft Dock With Laboratory

results.snippet: MOSCOW, Sept. 19 (AP)--A Cuban air force pilot and his Soviet mission commander docked their space capsule late today with an orbiting laboratory carrying two Soviet astronauts, Tass, the official Soviet press agency, said.
results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Sept. 19 (AP)--A Cuban air force pilot and his Soviet mission commander docked their space capsule late today with an orbiting laboratory carrying two Soviet astronauts, Tass, the official Soviet press agency, said.

headline.main: 2 in Soviet Spacecraft Dock With Laboratory

results.snippet: A Cuban air force pilot and his Soviet mission commander docked their space capsule late today with an orbiting laboratory carrying two Soviet astronauts, Tass, the official Soviet press agency, said.         It said that Arnaldo Tamayo Mendez, 38...
results.lead_paragraph: A Cuban air force pilot and his Soviet mission commander docked their space capsule late today with an orbiting laboratory carrying two Soviet astronauts, Tass, the official Soviet press agency, said. It said that Arnaldo Tamayo Mendez, 38 years old, Cuba's first astronaut, and the experienced spaceman Yuri V. Romanenko, 36, linked their Soyuz 37 spacecraft with the Salyut 6 space lab at 11:49 P.M. Moscow time. ''After docking and checking the air tightness of the docking unit,'' the two entered Salyut 6 and ''started joint studies on near-terrestrial orbit in the intersts of science and the national economy of socialist countries,'' Tass said.

results.abstract: Mendez and Romanenko are welcomed aboard Salyut 6 by Popov and Ryumin with traditional offering of bread and salt (S)

headline.main: Bread and Salt Greet 2 Visitors to Space Lab

results.snippet: MOSCOW, Sept. 20 (AP)--Cuba's first space voyager and his Soviet commander left their Soyuz 37 spacecraft today and boarded an orbiting space laboratory where two Soviet astronauts welcomed them with a traditional offering of bread and salt, the...
results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Sept. 20 (AP)--Cuba's first space voyager and his Soviet commander left their Soyuz 37 spacecraft today and boarded an orbiting space laboratory where two Soviet astronauts welcomed them with a traditional offering of bread and salt, the Soviet press agency Tass reported.

headline.main: Bread and Salt Greet 2 Visitors to Space Lab

results.snippet: Cuba's first space voyager and his Soviet commander left their Soyuz 37 spacecraft today and boarded an orbiting space laboratory where two Soviet astronauts welcomed them with a traditional offering of bread and salt, the Soviet press agency Tass...
results.lead_paragraph: Cuba's first space voyager and his Soviet commander left their Soyuz 37 spacecraft today and boarded an orbiting space laboratory where two Soviet astronauts welcomed them with a traditional offering of bread and salt, the Soviet press agency Tass reported. Arnaldo Tamayo Mendez, a 38-year-old Cuban pilot, and Yuri V. Romanenko, a veteran Soviet astronaut, linked their spacecraft with a Salyut 6 space laboratory late yesterday and more than three hours later floated into the orbiting space station, Tass, the Soviet press agency, said.
